title: GraphQL vs REST: Choosing the Right API
excerpt: A comprehensive comparison between GraphQL and REST APIs. When to use each and how to make the right choice for your project.
content:
## Introduction

The GraphQL vs REST debate continues. Let's objectively compare both approaches.

## REST Overview

Representational State Transfer:

- Resource-based URLs
- HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
- Stateless
- Well-understood and widely adopted

## GraphQL Overview

Query language for APIs:

- Single endpoint
- Client specifies exactly what data it needs
- Strongly typed schema
- Real-time with subscriptions

## When to Use REST

- Simple CRUD applications
- Public APIs with many consumers
- When caching is critical
- Team familiar with REST

## When to Use GraphQL

- Complex data requirements
- Mobile apps with bandwidth constraints
- Rapid frontend iteration
- Multiple clients with different needs

## Hybrid Approach

Many teams use both:

- REST for simple operations
- GraphQL for complex queries

## Conclusion

There's no universal winner. Choose based on your specific requirements.
